Package backend

Class GraphCreator

java.lang.Object
backend.GraphCreator
public class GraphCreator
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    GraphCreator()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> createCrimesOverTimeGraph​(java.util.ArrayList<Record> data)
    Creates a new XYChart.Series, then creates an ArrayList of LocalDateTimes for all the given crimes, which is then sorted, and used to calculate the graph x-axis spacing.
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> createCrimesPerBeatOverTimeGraph​(java.util.ArrayList<Record> data, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> crimeBeats)
    Creates a new XYChart.Series for each beat the user has selected, then creates an ArrayList of LocalDateTimes for each crime in each of those beats, along with an ArrayList of LocalDateTimes for all the beats selected, which are both then sorted, and the overall list of times is used to calculate the graph x-axis spacing, and then the crimes in each of the beats are rounded to that spacing, and then added to the ArrayList of XYChart.Series to be placed on a graph
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> createCrimesPerTypeOverTimeGraph​(java.util.ArrayList<Record> data, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> crimeTypes)
    Creates a new XYChart.Series for each crime type the user has selected, then creates an ArrayList of LocalDateTimes for each crime in each of those crime types, along with an ArrayList of LocalDateTimes for all the crime types selected, which are both then sorted, and the overall list of times is used to calculate the graph x-axis spacing, and then the crimes of each crime type are rounded to that spacing, and then added to the ArrayList of XYChart.Series to be placed on a graph
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> createCrimesPerWardOverTimeGraph​(java.util.ArrayList<Record> data, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> crimeWards)
    Creates a new XYChart.Series for each ward the user has selected, then creates an ArrayList of LocalDateTimes for each crime in each of those wards, along with an ArrayList of LocalDateTimes for all the wards selected, which are both then sorted, and the overall list of times is used to calculate the graph x-axis spacing, and then the crimes in each of the wards are rounded to that spacing, and then added to the ArrayList of XYChart.Series to be placed on the graph

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • GraphCreator

      public GraphCreator()

  • Method Details

    • createCrimesOverTimeGraph

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> createCrimesOverTimeGraph​(java.util.ArrayList<Record> data)
      Creates a new XYChart.Series, then creates an ArrayList of LocalDateTimes for all the given crimes, which is then sorted, and used to calculate the graph x-axis spacing. Then the crimes are placed on the XYChart.Series to be placed on the graph
      Parameters:
      data - An ArrayList of the crime records wanted to graph
      Returns:
      An XYChart.Series object containing all the data points as a pair, where the String is the date and time in string form and the Integer is the number of crimes that occurred in the calculated timeframe

    • createCrimesPerWardOverTimeGraph

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> createCrimesPerWardOverTimeGraph​(java.util.ArrayList<Record> data, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> crimeWards)
      Creates a new XYChart.Series for each ward the user has selected, then creates an ArrayList of LocalDateTimes for each crime in each of those wards, along with an ArrayList of LocalDateTimes for all the wards selected, which are both then sorted, and the overall list of times is used to calculate the graph x-axis spacing, and then the crimes in each of the wards are rounded to that spacing, and then added to the ArrayList of XYChart.Series to be placed on the graph
      Parameters:
      data - An ArrayList of the crime records wanted to graph
      crimeWards - An ArrayList of integers which contains the wards that need to be graphed
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of XYChart.Series objects containing all the data points as a pair, where the String is the date and time in string form and the Integer is the number of crimes that occurred in the calculated timeframe

    • createCrimesPerTypeOverTimeGraph

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> createCrimesPerTypeOverTimeGraph​(java.util.ArrayList<Record> data, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> crimeTypes)
      Creates a new XYChart.Series for each crime type the user has selected, then creates an ArrayList of LocalDateTimes for each crime in each of those crime types, along with an ArrayList of LocalDateTimes for all the crime types selected, which are both then sorted, and the overall list of times is used to calculate the graph x-axis spacing, and then the crimes of each crime type are rounded to that spacing, and then added to the ArrayList of XYChart.Series to be placed on a graph
      Parameters:
      data - An ArrayList of the crime records wanted to graph
      crimeTypes - An ArrayList of Strings which contains the types of crimes that need to be graphed
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of XYChart.Series objects containing all the data points as a pair, where the String is the date and time in string form and the Integer is the number of crimes that occurred in the calculated timeframe

    • createCrimesPerBeatOverTimeGraph

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> createCrimesPerBeatOverTimeGraph​(java.util.ArrayList<Record> data, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> crimeBeats)
      Creates a new XYChart.Series for each beat the user has selected, then creates an ArrayList of LocalDateTimes for each crime in each of those beats, along with an ArrayList of LocalDateTimes for all the beats selected, which are both then sorted, and the overall list of times is used to calculate the graph x-axis spacing, and then the crimes in each of the beats are rounded to that spacing, and then added to the ArrayList of XYChart.Series to be placed on a graph
      Parameters:
      data - An ArrayList of the crime records wanted to graph
      crimeBeats - An ArrayList of integers which contains the beats that need to be graphed
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of XYChart.Series objects containing all the data points as a pair, where the String is the date and time in string form and the Integer is the number of crimes that occurred in the calculated timeframe
